full_summary:
## Request for Standing Offer: Forklift Operator Training

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking a supplier to provide third-party certification for Forklift training courses to groups of offenders at various Federal Institutions in the Ontario Region.

### Tender Details

* Solicitation Number: 21C40-23-4459033
* Tender Closing Date: 7 March 2024, 14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: Not specified
* Expected Contract End Date: Not specified

### Scope of Work

The successful supplier will be required to provide in-person third-party certification for Forklift training courses to groups of offenders at the locations listed in the Location of Work. The supplier must provide certificates for successful participants within 21 days of course completion.

### Location of Work

The training will be delivered at various Federal Institutions in the Ontario Region, including:

* Joyceville Institution, Collins Bay, Bath Institution, CORCAN Regional Warehouse (STREAM 1)
* Grand Valley Institution (STREAM 2)
* Warkworth Institution (STREAM 3)
* Beaver Creek Institution (STREAM 4)
* CORCAN Regional Headquarters (STREAM 5)

### Deliverables

The supplier must provide:

* Sufficient resources to facilitate the Forklift Training courses
* Training materials, written, practical exercises, and testing as required
* All necessary materials for the delivery of the training
* Delivery of all materials and equipment to the location prior to the start of the course
* A list of successful participants to the Project Authority
* Hard copy of certificates for successful participants within 21 days of course completion

### Security Requirements

This standing offer includes security requirements.

### Duration of Standing Offer

The standing offer will be effective from the award date to 30 April 2025, with the option to renew for two additional one-year periods.

### Contact Information

Aimée Legault
Phone: 343-597-2485
Email: Aimee.Legault@csc-scc.gc.ca

Note to Bidders:

* Bidders may obtain the complete statement of work and evaluation criteria by downloading the solicitation document and associated documents from the Canada buys/tender opportunities website.
* The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).
* After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process. Bidders should make the request to the Contracting Authority within fifteen
